derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French scaloun, based on Latin Ascalonia (caepa) ('onion) of Ascalon', a port in ancient Palestine

entry.def: A scallion is a small onion with long green leaves.

means.word_mean: 1. plant having a large slender white bulb and flat overlapping dark green leaves; used in cooking; believed derived from the wild Allium ampeloprasum
2. young onion before the bulb has enlarged

auth_sentence.content: Smash remaining ginger and scallion with cleaver and add to pot, along with remaining Shaoxing wine and white pepper.
